r4tune - (03:06): that code you gave me earlier  
r4tune - (03:07): can i query document properties with it too? xwiki.searchDocuments(", BaseObject obj where obj.name=doc.fullName and doc.fullName LIKE 'Todo%' and obj.className = 'XWiki.TodoClass'" and doc.PROPERTY = 1 and doc.DATEPROPERTY < now)  
r4tune - (03:23): xwiki.searchDocuments(", BaseObject obj, StringPriperty as prop1 where obj.name=doc.fullName and obj.className = 'XWiki.TodoClass'" and obj.id=prop1.id.id and prop1.id.name = "ReceiveReminder" and prop1.value = '1')  
r4tune - (03:23): grr  
r4tune - (03:24): i'm going to have to learn java i've managed to avoid it for 10 years  
r4tune - (03:24): damn  
r4tune - (03:27): xwiki.searchDocuments(", BaseObject obj, IntegerPriperty as prop1 where obj.name=doc.fullName and obj.className = 'XWiki.TodoClass'" and obj.id=prop1.id.id and prop1.id.name = "ReceiveReminder" and prop1.value = 1)  
r4tune - (03:27): lol spelltard  
r4tune - (03:27): i think im gettin it

tmortagne - (09:02): guys i get tons of INFO logs when starting XWiki on trunks  
tmortagne - (09:02): since yesterday  
tmortagne - (09:03): i don't see any recent modification to log4j.properties  
sburjan` - (09:04): well something changed  
sburjan` - (09:04): I got them from last week at the end  
silviar left at 09:05 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
tmortagne - (09:05): i get lots of log all the time actually  
tmortagne - (09:06): since i get logs for every hibernate and scheduler action  
tmortagne - (09:06): looks like log4j.properties is not taken into account at all  
sburjan` - (09:07): I got around 5000 line / page action  
sburjan` - (09:07): \*lines  
tmortagne - (09:08): yep i did not count but i get a lot  
sburjan` - (09:08): well, odd .. sergiu said it's log4j  
sburjan` - (09:08): badly configured  
tmortagne - (09:08): well it's not  
sburjan` - (09:08): that's really odd  
tmortagne - (09:08): since i don't have custom log4j  
tmortagne - (09:08): log4j.properties  
tmortagne - (09:09): so something changed at log4j level or the way we are using log4j in XWiki that makes it not look at log4j.properties file located in core jar  
evalica joined #xwiki at 09:10  
sburjan` - (09:10): anyway.. this should ba e blocker for release  
sburjan` - (09:10): it slows down ther execution .. because it can't output faster in console  
tmortagne - (09:11): yes it's definitely a blocker  
tmortagne - (09:11): log is totally unusable with all this logged  
silviar1 joined #xwiki at 09:12  
sburjan` - (09:14): yeah.. if a new error arises, it will be very difficult tu see it  
sburjan` - (09:14): and to distinguish between this and another errors  
sburjan` - (09:14): sergiu tole me that these errors are normal, but the fact that they are displayed is not normal  
sburjan` - (09:15): \*told  
sburjan` - (09:15): brb in 30  
tmortagne - (09:16): haha i think i found  
tmortagne - (09:16): the bad one :)  
tmortagne - (09:16): xwiki-core-csrftoken jar contains a log4j.properties file  
tmortagne - (09:20): should be ok now

tmortagne - (09:54): sburjan: looks like you did not read my previous messages :)  
r4tune - (09:54): is there a good GUI database viewer so I can see the layout of the database xwiki keeps to help me develop my scripts?  
sburjan - (09:54): no, I was gone :)  
tmortagne - (09:54): (09:16:02 AM) tmortagne: haha i think i found  
tmortagne - (09:54): (09:16:11 AM) tmortagne: the bad one :)  
tmortagne - (09:54): (09:16:30 AM) tmortagne: xwiki-core-csrftoken jar contains a log4j.properties file  
tmortagne - (09:54): (09:20:52 AM) tmortagne: should be ok now  
r4tune - (09:55): i see xwiki more like an OS, i often make my code OSS too so... :)  
sburjan - (09:55): I see  
sburjan - (09:55): and when the noew build will be ready so i can test ?  
tmortagne - (09:55): sburjan: check http://hudson.xwiki.org  
r4tune - (09:55): picking up bits of it just by reading yer api docs  
tmortagne - (09:55): r4tune: which database engine ?  
r4tune - (09:55): hypersonic  
r4tune - (09:56): someone said it came with one on a poste  
r4tune - (09:56): but i ran the command and the jar file doesn't have that method  
r4tune - (09:56): i've got the "download and go" wiki while i'm still playing  
r4tune - (09:56): though it's already becoming my central info store and im putting features in it like it send my cell phone reminders for todos  
r4tune - (09:57): it's kickass  
r4tune - (09:57): i almost chose foswiki  
r4tune - (09:57): lucky escape  
tmortagne - (09:57): i think http://www.dbvis.com/ support pretty much anything  
r4tune - (09:58): cheers  
tmortagne - (09:59): r4tune: i usually work with mysql and used the UI they provide  
r4tune - (10:00): /me might migrate it  
r4tune - (10:00): i found your copywiki function  
r4tune - (10:00): :)  
r4tune - (10:02): feature request: patch tiny\_mce not to cry if i'm running chromium (which it thinks is safari) because the dev couldn't be assed to support it so shows an alert box  
r4tune - (10:02): one alert box with a don't show me again would be ok  
r4tune - (10:02): i commented out the code but it was well annoying  
tmortagne - (10:03): r4tune: there is really no change to see any work done in tiny\_mce, you should use the new WYSIWYG  
r4tune - (10:03): it was pulled in via a third party plugin  
tmortagne - (10:03): which mean not use xwiki/1.0 syntax  
r4tune - (10:04): i thought maybe some of your core might do it too  
r4tune - (10:04): a to-do list  
r4tune - (10:04): which i patched to send SMS to my phone as reminders  
r4tune - (10:04): hehe  
lpereira joined #xwiki at 10:04  
r4tune - (10:05): in fact i'm working on fixing an 8 year old ticket in vim for it's native dav support just cuz i want to use it with xwiki  
r4tune - (10:05): can do it via KDE using the kioslave but it doesn't update until i close vim which is a slowdown  
r4tune - (10:07): oh yeah i can code vim too  
r4tune - (10:07): and emacs own lisp  
r4tune - (10:07): i see great things for it  
r4tune - (10:08): really is more like an OS  
r4tune - (10:08): it seemed like C++ with less suck that ran slower  
r4tune - (10:10): all the cool kids (from the enterprise) are on c# now tho save for the phone crew mostly afaik?  
r4tune - (10:10): us hackers are still rollin with perl/python :P  
r4tune - (10:15): afk

jvdrean1 - (10:28):  Hi all, I'm thinking about displaying a visual clue (for ex. an icon) after links pointing to a wiki different from the current wiki. The first use case would be to display all users (global + local) in the same lists but have a small distinction between them  
mflorea - (10:28): vmassol: quick question: can I use @Requirement in a AbstractMockingComponentTestCase to have a mock component inject in the test case? Thanks  
vmassol - (10:30): mflorea: I think so but I need to check  
mflorea - (10:31): I can write getComponent().lookup(MyComponent.class) in the test method to get a mock but I want to avoid writing this in each method so I have to options: use @Requirement or use setUp() to initialize  
mflorea - (10:33): I think only @MockingRequirement are injected

Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:12  
bblfish left at 11:21 (Quit: Leaving.  
cjdelisle - (11:29): Good morning, do you need PR to save a class with a DatabaseList property?  
tmortagne - (11:31): cjdelisle: do you mean "please answer yes or we have a problem" ? ;)  
cjdelisle - (11:31): Well the next question was going to be about "update" ;)  
cjdelisle - (11:32): (testing now.)  
tmortagne - (11:32): i hope too but i would say no  
cjdelisle - (11:33): If update is blocked then it's not a huge problem.  
sdumitriu - (11:35): cjdelisle: No, DBList with HQL query always works without any PR required  
sdumitriu - (11:36): Don't tell anyone  
cjdelisle - (11:40): quick test: drop statements don't run so it appears to be just a confidentiality issue, I'll file it as minor.  
cjdelisle - (11:41): Should an issue like this even be set secret? IMO we abuse the jira secret function sometimes.  
evalica left at 11:49 (Quit: Leaving.  
evalica joined #xwiki at 11:49  
mflorea - (11:52): vmassol: I have a problem testing an \_Initializable\_ component using AbstractMockingComponentTestCase. This component uses a configuration component in its initialize() method. All my tests fail in AbstractMockingComponentTestCase#setUp() when my tested component is being initialized, because the call to the configuration component is not expected. Do you know how can I fix this?  
mflorea - (11:54): I can't specify the expectation before the super.setUp() because the config component is not macked yet  
arkub joined #xwiki at 11:55  
tmortagne - (11:56): mflorea:  
tmortagne - (11:56):     /\*\*  
tmortagne - (11:56):      \* Provides a hook so that users of this class can perform configuration before the component  
tmortagne - (11:56):      \* is looked up. This allows for example the ability to set expectations on mocked components  
tmortagne - (11:56):      \* used in Initializable.initialize() methods.  
tmortagne - (11:56):      \*/  
tmortagne - (11:56):     public void configure() throws Exception  
tmortagne - (11:56):     {  
tmortagne - (11:56):         // Do nothing by default, this method is supposed to be overridden if needed.  
tmortagne - (11:56):     }  
tmortagne - (11:56): i think you need to override configure  
mflorea - (11:56): tmortagne: let me try  
venkatesh left at 12:00 (Ping timeout: 240 seconds  
cjdelisle - (12:05): The floating actionMenu needs a bigger z-index, it is covered up by the form fields in the class editor.  
jvdrean1 - (12:08): don't we have a script service for the configuration component ?  
silviar left at 12:11 (Quit: Leaving.  
tmortagne - (12:14): jvdrean1: there is no unique configuration component, the common thing we have is files and preferences ConfigurationSource which is not safe to allow anyone to access to it (except the xwikipreference one but there is no script service for it AFAIK)  
jvdrean1 - (12:16): ah right it'd create a security hole  
tmortagne - (12:17): yep  
abusenius left at 12:18 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
vmassol - (12:18): (and we want typed apis too)  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 12:18  
kwoot\_ joined #xwiki at 12:37  
kwoot\_ - (12:38): So, I managed to build at least the trunks/platform yesterday. But mavenopts should be doube: 2048 en 256m. Shall I add a small 'quick and dirty' section to the build page?  
kwoot\_ - (12:38): wiki build i don't know yet because i went to sleep when it was compiling. will check later on.  
vmassol - (12:38): kwoot\_: I think we already have that info  
vmassol - (12:39): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building#HTroubleshooting  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 12:39  
kwoot\_ - (12:39): vmassol: i just wrote to double the maven settings, so compared to the page you mention.  
vmassol - (12:39): kwoot\_: I build fine with MAVEN\_OPTS="-Xmx1024m -XX:MaxPermSize=128m"  
vmassol - (12:40): it all depends on your JVM + what you're building  
vmassol - (12:40): this troubleshooting section just explains how to increase  
kwoot\_ - (12:40): and since the page tells a lot but there is no section like 'i dont have the time tell me what to do to get it up and running asap' I just thought that quick and direty would be a nice addition.  
vmassol - (12:40): it doesn't tell you what value to use  
kwoot\_ - (12:41): vmassol: it doesn't tell you what value to use => very, very confusing.  
vmassol - (12:41): kwoot\_: WDYM?  
kwoot\_ - (12:41): my jvm is sun jdk 1.6.20. and yours?  
vmassol - (12:41): I'm on mac first  
vmassol - (12:41): using java full version "1.6.0\_20-b02-279"  
vmassol - (12:42): kwoot\_: what modules was causing the memory issue for you?  
vmassol - (12:43): did you run with -Pdev profile?  
kwoot\_ - (12:43): I mean confusing because when you say that a setting is not meant to tell me what to use i wonder what it is doing on that page then :-)  
vmassol - (12:43): kwoot\_: but there's no good value!  
vmassol - (12:43): as show in this thread!  
vmassol - (12:43): s/show/shown/  
kwoot\_ - (12:43): I did not do Pdev yet, I am very, very newbie and just wanted to see to have it compile.  
vmassol - (12:43): -Pdev will save you hours....  
kwoot\_ - (12:44): Is it possible that some factory does not compile because of some zero error?  
kwoot\_ - (12:44): platform compile took 79 minutes. I have a ml370g4 allocated to play with. :-)  
vmassol - (12:44): it should take about 20 mn I think  
vmassol - (12:44): try with -Pdev  
kwoot\_ - (12:45): I will, tonight :-)  
vmassol - (12:45): I'm just wondernig if it's the gwt module that needs the extra memory you needed ornot  
vmassol - (12:45): of course we can easily say:  
vmassol - (12:45): use this:  
kwoot\_ - (12:45): really looking forward to work on this project in my spare time.  
vmassol - (12:45): MAVEN\_OPTS="-Xmx102400m -XX:MaxPermSize=12800m"  
vmassol - (12:45): and we're good and you'll be happy  
vmassol - (12:46): since the doc will precisely say what to use  
cjdelisle - (12:46): :)  
kwoot\_ - (12:46): I will test with your maven opts and let you know or put the compile on pastebin.  
vmassol - (12:46): :)  
cjdelisle - (12:46): swap swap swap swap swap  
jvdrean1 left at 12:46 (Quit: Leaving.  
kwoot\_ - (12:46): :-)  
vmassol - (12:46): kwoot\_: but I'm all for improving the doc  
kwoot\_ - (12:46): currenty 1Gb mem in the machine.  
vmassol - (12:46): I just don't want to specify high values if they're not really needed  
vmassol - (12:47): we need to find why we need so much memory  
vmassol - (12:47): that's better IMO  
cjdelisle - (12:47): because it's java?  
vmassol - (12:47): come on :)  
kwoot\_ - (12:47): so if your macen opts should work, and i am a newbie why could it then be that it does not compile? oh right, thats why you want to see the errors. got it.  
vmassol - (12:48): cool you're doing questions and answers :)  
kwoot\_ - (12:48): yep. lets port it all to c#.... rotfl  
cjdelisle - (12:48): export MAVEN\_OPTS='-Xmx500m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m'  
vmassol - (12:49): cjdelisle: is that what you use?  
cjdelisle - (12:49): yup.  
vmassol - (12:49): with -Pdev ?  
kwoot\_ - (12:49): ok. will try those as well. For a full compile or Pdev?  
cjdelisle - (12:49): With or without.  
vmassol - (12:49): ok....  
kwoot\_ - (12:49): interesting.  
cjdelisle - (12:49): [user@fc9p4 trunks]$ java -version  
cjdelisle - (12:49): java version "1.6.0"  
cjdelisle - (12:49): OpenJDK  Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0-b09)  
cjdelisle - (12:49): OpenJDK Client VM (build 1.6.0-b09, mixed mode)  
kwoot\_ - (12:50): vmassol: i am multi tasking: questions and answers all the time :-)  
vmassol - (12:50): kwoot\_: the memory needed can also be a factor of the maven version you use  
cjdelisle - (12:50): "lets port it all to c#" C# is the same, utf-16 + xml eats memory.  
kwoot\_ - (12:51): if you like to know that now, I can ssh from work to home, power on the ml370 and give you the answer... talking about being a real nerd.... :-)  
kwoot\_ - (12:52): C# is single platform and I do not take it seriously. sorry for bringing it up.  
evalica left at 12:53 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 12:54  
evalica joined #xwiki at 12:54  
bblfish joined #xwiki at 12:54  
silviar joined #xwiki at 13:05  
kwoot\_ - (13:08): and now for something completely different: how can I see the source of an older version of a page?  
sdumitriu - (13:10): kwoot\_: You can't from the UI, but it's possible from the URL  
vmassol - (13:10): kwoot\_: yes I think we have a limitation for this  
vmassol - (13:10): in the UI  
sdumitriu - (13:10): Just append ?viewer=code&rev=1.2 to the URL  
vmassol - (13:10): we should allow it IMO  
kwoot\_ left at 13:12 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
vmassol - (13:15): tmortagne: ping skype (I think your skype crashed)  
sburjan` left at 13:16 (Read error: Connection reset by peer  
asrfel left at 13:18 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
asrfel joined #xwiki at 13:19  
kwoot\_ joined #xwiki at 13:22  
kwoot\_ - (13:23): sorry for disconnect. seems so rude in the middle of a question.  
kwoot\_ - (13:23): yes, view source could be a column on the history page so people can copy paste it for example.  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 13:24  
kwoot\_ - (13:24): Hm, don't know if you should capture dum url's:  
kwoot\_ - (13:24): WebHome?rev=87.1?viewer=code  
kwoot\_ - (13:24): gives error  
kwoot\_ - (13:25): Detailed information:     Error number 0 in 11: Uncaught exception Wrapped Exception: 87.1?viewer=code com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiException: Error number 0 in 11: Uncaught exception Wrapped Exception: 87.1?viewer=code at com.xpn.xwiki.web.XWikiAction.execute(XWikiAction.java:238)  
kwoot\_ - (13:25): and the WebHome?rev=87.1&viewer=code works fine btw.  
vmassol - (13:32): jvdrean: btw the Add menu item is still larger than the menu bar  
mflorea - (13:33): tmortagne: overwriting the configure method did the trick, thanks! Now, I have another, less important, question: what's the best practice when expectation blocks are too long (for the checkstyle, i.e. > 20 lines)?  
vmassol - (13:33): if expectations blocks are too long it means there's a design issue in general  
vmassol - (13:34): what checkstyle error do you get marius?  
mflorea - (13:34): I see, the tested method calls too many external methods  
lucaa left at 13:34 (Ping timeout: 252 seconds  
vmassol - (13:34): yep something like this  
vmassol - (13:34): it might mean an object is missing somewhere  
mflorea - (13:35): vmassol: I get "Anonymous inner class length is 24 lines (max allowed is 20)"  
mflorea - (13:35): on getMockery().checking(new Expectations()  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:36  
vmassol - (13:36): actually I didn't remember we were running checkstyle on tests but it's probably a good thing  
mflorea - (13:36): no, we don't do it by default, but I'm doing it on officepreview module  
mflorea - (13:37): the only checkstyle error I have right now is this  
mflorea - (13:37): re max limit, considering that you usually write groups of (oneOf, will, empty line), it means that normally an expectation should contain at most 6 groups  
vmassol - (13:38): it means either you're not mocking at the right level or that indeed the tested class is calling too many external stuff  
vmassol - (13:38): now  
vmassol - (13:38): I don't know if 24 is a good value or not  
vmassol - (13:38): for expectations  
mflorea - (13:38): 20 is the limit, for anonymous inner classes  
lucaa left at 13:38 (Client Quit  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 13:38  
mflorea - (13:39): well, I have 24, which is not acceptable IMO, but it's over the limit  
mflorea - (13:39): s/is not acceptable/is acceptable  
vmassol - (13:39): 6 is probably on the low side. I'd say around 10 expectations max would be a good threshold  
vmassol - (13:40): but this is a wild guess, I have no idea what a good value really is  
vmassol - (13:40): of course the minimum possible number is always the best  
mflorea - (13:42): yes, the problem is that you can have 6 expectations, but if you use long variable names and you have methods with 2, 3 parameters an expectation will take more lines  
mflorea - (13:42): it will take more lines because because of formatting  
mflorea - (13:44): removing the empty lines between the expectations fixes the problem but the code is harder to read..  
vmassol - (13:45): I'm surprised that empty lines are not ignored  
vmassol - (13:45): (by default)  
vmassol - (13:46): OTOH this is really specific to jmock  
vmassol - (13:46): the anonymous inner class pattern  
mflorea - (13:46): comment lines are included also..  
vmassol - (13:46): http://checkstyle.sourceforge.net/config\_sizes.html#AnonInnerLength  
vmassol - (13:46): we can use a named inner class but it flows less well in tests  
vmassol - (13:46): s/named inner class/named class/  
mflorea - (13:47): yes  
vmassol - (13:47): btw you can cheat too  
vmassol - (13:47): and separate the expectations into groups of expectations
